prefix: You are an expert in number theory. Solve the following problem.
problem_prompt:
You are an expert in number theory. Solve the following problem. Let $m$ be the product of all positive integers less than $4!$ which are invertible modulo $4!$. Find the remainder when $m$ is divided by $4!$.

(Here $n!$ denotes $1\times\cdots\times n$ for each positive integer $n$.)
gpt_response:
Recall that an integer $a$ is invertible modulo $n$ if there exists an integer $b$ such that $ab \equiv 1 \pmod{n}$. In other words, $a$ is invertible modulo $n$ if $\gcd(a,n) = 1$.

Since $4!=24$, we want to find the product of all positive integers less than 24 that are coprime to 24. These numbers are 1, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17, 19, 23. 

So, $m = 1 \times 5 \times 7 \times 11 \times 13 \times 17 \times 19 \times 23$.

To find the remainder when $m$ is divided by 24, we can simplify each factor modulo 24:

$1 \equiv 1 \pmod{24}$
$5 \equiv 5 \pmod{24}$
$7 \equiv 7 \pmod{24}$
$11 \equiv -1 \pmod{24}$
$13 \equiv -11 \pmod{24}$
$17 \equiv -7 \pmod{24}$
$19 \equiv -5 \pmod{24}$
$23 \equiv -1 \pmod{24}$

Multiplying these results together, we have $m \equiv 1 \times 5 \times 7 \times -1 \times -11 \times -7 \times -5 \times -1 \equiv 1 \times 5 \times 7 \times 11 \times 13 \times 17 \times 19 \times 23 \equiv \boxed{1} \pmod{24}$.
solution_prompt:
The following is a response to a question. Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following response 1?: Recall that an integer $a$ is invertible modulo $n$ if there exists an integer $b$ such that $ab \equiv 1 \pmod{n}$. In other words, $a$ is invertible modulo $n$ if $\gcd(a,n) = 1$.

Since $4!=24$, we want to find the product of all positive integers less than 24 that are coprime to 24. These numbers are 1, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17, 19, 23. 

So, $m = 1 \times 5 \times 7 \times 11 \times 13 \times 17 \times 19 \times 23$.

To find the remainder when $m$ is divided by 24, we can simplify each factor modulo 24:

$1 \equiv 1 \pmod{24}$
$5 \equiv 5 \pmod{24}$
$7 \equiv 7 \pmod{24}$
$11 \equiv -1 \pmod{24}$
$13 \equiv -11 \pmod{24}$
$17 \equiv -7 \pmod{24}$
$19 \equiv -5 \pmod{24}$
$23 \equiv -1 \pmod{24}$

Multiplying these results together, we have $m \equiv 1 \times 5 \times 7 \times -1 \times -11 \times -7 \times -5 \times -1 \equiv 1 \times 5 \times 7 \times 11 \times 13 \times 17 \times 19 \times 23 \equiv \boxed{1} \pmod{24}$.
